Undergraduate Student Records for Longitudinal Research

Source: R/midfieldr.R
midfieldr.Rd

A package for investigating a data sample from the MIDFIELD database. The data comprise student records from registrars at participating US universities, including demographic, term, course, and degree information for 97,640 undergraduate students from 1987 to 2016.

Source

Data provided by the MIDFIELD project: https://engineering.purdue.edu/MIDFIELD

Details

This package provides functions to access, manipulate, and graph student record data. For example, to examine graduation rates, we use the series of functions:

  • cip_filter() to select programs

  • gather_start() to gather students starting in the programs

  • gather_grad() to gather unique students graduating from the programs

  • race_sex_join() to join student sex and race

  • zero_fill() fill zero for missing combinations

  • tally_gradrate() to compute graduation rates for each group

To learn about these and other functions, start with the vignettes: browseVignettes(package = "midfieldr").

We generally group our findings by instructional program and student sex and "race" as defined by the participating US institutions for the years spanned in the sample data.

Instructional program data is provided in cip, a data frame of names and codes of academic programs from the 2010 IPEDS Classification of Instructional Programs (CIP) by the US Department of Education.

Student record data is provided in four data packages: midfieldstudents, midfieldcourses, midfieldterms, and midfielddegrees.
